Description: Wheel-made footed bowl in Nile silt with a conical foot and a rim that tapers in slightly. Fabric contains many tiny dark stones and mica and the occaional calcium carbonate piece, Adams Type R32. Vessel is painted unevenly in a pale orange on the interior and exterior, with a large eroded patch on the exterior. A swirling vine pattern is painted in black on the body, featuring a grape surrounded by 2 leaves curving back.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 35) (Type D14)
